definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: He suggested that tangling fishing gear should be made a criminal offence.
sentences.chinese: 他提议，缠绕捕鱼器材应该算刑事犯罪。

sentences.english: In crime case spot, the shoe imprints is one of most common traces.
sentences.chinese: 在刑事犯罪案件现场，鞋印是最为常见的痕迹之一。

sentences.english: In each of the first carts sat six invalid criminal convicts, close packed.
sentences.chinese: 前头的大车每辆坐着六个刑事犯，很拥挤。

sentences.english: The man was charged with criminal mischief.
sentences.chinese: 而这名裸男则被以刑事犯罪的罪名逮捕。

sentences.english: Fallon cautions that this is a young field.
sentences.chinese: 法伦警告说，研究刑事犯的大脑是一个年轻的领域。

sentences.english: We will crack down on crimes in accordance with the law to safeguard national security and social stability.
sentences.chinese: 依法打击刑事犯罪活动，维护国家安全和社会稳定。

sentences.english: Criminalizing such conduct would threaten the freedom of the press, he said.
sentences.chinese: 将这类接触归入刑事犯罪，将危及新闻自由，他表示。

sentences.english: We met Baida in the office of the head nurse for the criminally insane.
sentences.chinese: 我在负责刑事犯病人的护士长的办公室里见到了拜妲。

sentences.english: Rehabilitation of prisoners may carry three distinct meanings .
sentences.chinese: 刑事犯的恢复声誉可能包括三个截然不同的含义。

sentences.english: Criminals are kept in the cages on this island.
sentences.chinese: 刑事犯被关在岛上的牢房里。

sentences.english: The underworld crimes are the outstanding expressive type of crimes in the new situations.
sentences.chinese: 黑恶势力犯罪是新时期刑事犯罪最突出的表现形式。

sentences.english: Because of one insignificant offence he was branded a common criminal.
sentences.chinese: 由于一次轻微的过错他蒙受了普通刑事犯的污名。

sentences.english: His case should be subsumed under the title of criminal offence.
sentences.chinese: 他的案子应归入刑事犯罪。

definition: on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
